column1: Narrator : The island is immense. CAPITAINE can't see anything, but faintly hears music from behinds the sand dunes near the beach.

column2: Narrator : Approaching the music, CAPITAINE hears a cacophonic chatter inside a immense building. From hear, CAPITAINE smells the alcohol and hears the dice rolling, it’s some kind of gambling place for sure.

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE steps into an old gambling house, crowded with shouting sailors. They’re all playing heated games of cards and dice.
column4: Narrator : CAPITAINE opens the doors of a shabby bar. A few players betting their last coins or possessions. Behind the counter, a waiter is wiping a few tankards.
column11: Narrator : In a dark and narrow room, CAPITAINE stands in front of a few tense men, sitting around a table. Some other sailors are playing cards, dice and other scams
column14: Narrator : CAPITAINE steps into a bar, crowded with heated sailors, playing all kind of games of cards and dice.
Narrator : Some musicians in the corner are playing to lighten the mood.

column16: Choice : (go and listen to the musicians)
Narrator : A famous irish tune is playing, « The Wild Rover », CAPITAINE lays back and rests his ears from the heavy clatter of the waves.
column17: Narrator : A famous irish tune is playing, « Raglan Road », CAPITAINE lays back and rests his ears from the heavy clatter of the waves.
column18: Narrator : Everybody’s singing along the famous sailor shanty  « Blow the Man Down ». CAPITAINE sings along, forgetting his quest for just a little while.
column19: Narrator : Everybody’s singing along the famous sailor shanty  « Fiddler’s Green ». CAPITAINE sings along, forgetting his quest for just a little while.

column10: Narrator : Before CAPITAINE can step forward, a handful of men approaches.

column2: Choice : Is there space for another player?
column3: Choice : Anyone of you good people heard of NOMTRESOR ?
column7: OtherSpeak : Oh look another opportunist loony
column15: OtherSpeak : Look! Our sailor’s coming back!

column7: OtherSpeak : As a matter of fact, yes.
OtherSpeak : We have all kinds of senseless sailors betting on our table.
column10: OtherSpeak : We have a favour to ask if you have some time?

column4: OtherSpeak : Nope, doesn't ring a bell, sorry.
column7: OtherSpeak : And what they say might interest you, you see.
OtherSpeak : Only thing is, and I think you guessed it.
OtherSpeak : Us gambling people aren’t the specie to give anything for free.
column10: OtherSpeak : A dog ate all of our cards. Don’t ask how it happened.

column7: OtherSpeak : Tell you what : We’ll bet on it !
column10: OtherSpeak : So we have money to put on the table, but no cards to play with...
OtherSpeak : You wouldn’t have a spare one, by any chance?

column7: Choice : Count me in, you crook.
column8: Choice : It figures, but I’ll pass on the scam.

column1: Narrator : The gambling house is empty. The staff and musicians all left during the fight.
column7: OtherSpeak : It’s simple : You win the game, you get the info.
column12: Choice : Sorry, I’m keeping this one…
column14: Choice : Sorry pals, I don’t have any.

column7: OtherSpeak : You lose, and we get the money !

column13: OtherSpeak : Then I guess we’ll have to take it from you!

column11: OtherSpeak : But if you find one, you know where to find us!

column5: PlayerSpeak : That's what I'm talkin' about!
column10: OtherSpeak : Why don’t you play with us?

column2: Narrator : There’s nothing to grab here, apart from a deck of cards that miraculously wasn't scattered during the fighting.
column3: Narrator : The gambling house is completely trashed, nothing survived the fight.
column4: Narrator : The gambling house is completely trashed, nothing survived the fight.
column10: OtherSpeak : Here’s something to start with! As a thank you gift!

column4: Narrator : But a very strange tatoo on one of the dead gamblers attracts your attention.
Narrator : Atop the classic anchor and « mommy » tatoo, « NOMTRESOR » is tatooed in a childish way.
column11: Choice : I’m good for now, but thanks for the coin!

column4: Narrator : Even more strange, the tatoo is circled many times by the word « FORMULA ».
column10: Choice : A little game won’t kill me...

column4: Narrator : Let’s take note and leave.

column1: OtherSpeak : Howdy sailor, what’s your poison today?

column5: Choice : I need info about NOMTRESOR if you heard of it?
column12: Choice : What’s going on ‘round these parts ?

column5: OtherSpeak : Ah yeah! From what I hear here, and I hear a lot trust me…
column6: OtherSpeak : Nope, doesn't ring a bell, sorry.
column10: OtherSpeak : It depends on the players luck mostly.
column12: OtherSpeak : If  you want alcohol, I’m here.

column10: OtherSpeak : Sometimes, we’re one dice roll away from being bankrupt!
column12: OtherSpeak : You want conversation buddy, go get friends.
